vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application contains hardcoded SSH credentials including username and password, which are only lightly obfuscated with base64 encoding

semantic_details.description: Hardcoded credentials in application code that can be easily decoded
scenario: Attacker views source code through /source endpoint
Attacker decodes the base64 encoded password
Attacker uses credentials to gain SSH access to the server

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application exposes its own source code through a dedicated endpoint

semantic_details.description: Application exposes its source code, revealing sensitive information like credentials and implementation details
scenario: Application returns its own source code
Attacker identifies vulnerabilities and sensitive information

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application executes a command on the remote system via SSH without proper input validation

semantic_details.description: The application executes the 'ps -aux' command via SSH without any validation or sanitization
scenario: If the command variable could be manipulated (in a more complex version of this app)
An attacker could inject additional commands to be executed on the remote system
Commands would be executed with the privileges of the SSH user
